thread.title: ‘It’s not a crisis’ - #FeesMustFall quotes of the week
thread.title_full: ‘It’s not a crisis’ - #FeesMustFall quotes of the week | News24

author: news24.com
title: ‘It’s not a crisis’ - #FeesMustFall quotes of the week
text:
Cape Town - From Blade Nzimande claiming the nationwide fees protest is not a crisis, to comparisons to the Arab Spring, we bring you a roundup of the best Quote: s from #FeesMustFall so far.
“[My father] was crushed when he found out that he had to raise R6 500 for registration. We have livestock at home so my parents had to sell one cow to raise the money.” -18-year-old Banele Mathenjwa's parents had to sell one of their most prized possessions to send him to university.
"It is a challenge, but I wouldn't call it a crisis. A crisis implies that the situation is so bad that there are no mechanisms to deal with it. There are mechanisms in place." - Minister of Higher Education and Training Blade Nzimande .
“The ANC must stop being arrogant and implement free higher education for the poor. We also demand that the ANC recalls Higher Education Minister Dr Blade Nzimande .” - Former Wits SRC president Mcebo Dlamini addressing students outside Luthuli House on Thursday.
